properties.title: Union Beach Hub @ the Union Hose "Firehouse Grille"
properties.description:
NEEDS/REQUESTS: 

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED: 

Muck-out volunteers - please come with muck-out supplies, if possible (OSHA N95/N92 face-masks, waterproof boots, waterproof work-gloves, hazmat suits (or at the very least heavy-duty work clothes you can throw away; and clean clothes, of course), tarps, garbage bags, crow-bars, headlamps, batteries). 

Kitchen volunteers - nespecially in morning, to prepare food for regional distribution, for volunteers, and for residents. More needed on weekends.

Long-term volunteers are invited to camp at this hub, which is run by the Rainbow Superstorm Sandy Response. Please be respectful of the norms of the camp. Be sure to bring very warm clothes, as this is a cold, windy, wet, coastal spot. Bring your own tents and sleeping bags. This camp is located at the site of Union Hose Fire Company #1, at the invitation of the firehouse, so there should be no problems from local authorities. The camp is providing a vital service to the local community without taxing limited local resources.

SUPPLIES NEEDED:

OSHA N95/N92 face-masks, waterproof boots, waterproof work-gloves, hazmat suits, heavy-duty work clothes, tarps, waterproof plastic bins, crow-bars, headlamps, batteries, garbage bags.

Food is always welcome (extra can be sent to other parts of the state), though the camp is incredibly well supplied.

If you plan to bring or send tons of stuff, check in with the P.O.C. on the ground first to ensure they have capacity to receive it.

properties.title: St. Mary's
properties.description:
VOLUNTEERS:

Needed Tuesday - Saturday, 10a - 5p. Looking for 4 chefs per day. People who can do full days preferred. People with culinary experience, and can be efficient in a small space preferred. 

NEEDS: 

Food: Barley, Quinoa, Brown rice, Pasta, Egg noodles, Flour, Sugar, Dried cranberries, Dried apricots, Tortillas, Dried: lentils, split peas, Cooking liquid, Boxes of white and red wine, Guinness stout

Canned: Tomatoes, Canned beans (any), Better than Boullion soup base, Peanut butter, Tuna, Salmon, Canned chicken, Jam, Relish, Tahini, Roasted red peppers, Artichokes, Olives, Capers, Tofu, Baby Corn, Water chestnuts, Canned chiles, Olive oil, Canola oil

Meat: Whole uncut pieces of meat we can break down ourselves are fine. Seriously- any cheap cut of meat will do. No offal. Pork shoulder, Ribs, Stew beef, Ground beef, London broil/skirt steak, Chicken thighs, Bacon, Ham, Hot dogs, Sausage

Vegetables: Onions, Potatoes, Carrots, Celery, Garlic, Sweet potatoes, Apples

Frozen: Edamame, Spinach, Pearl onions, Green beans

Dairy (prefer gift cards for these items): Milk, Cream, Cream cheese, Eggs, Parmesan cheese

Miscellaneous: Paper bags, Take out containers (pints and quarts), Ziplock bags, Aluminum pans with cover, Aluminum foil, Plastic wrap, Sandwich baggies, Deli paper, Latex gloves

Will also need LOTS of fresh produce

Supplies:  Note that we'd be happy borrowing any of this from restaurants who are not using them, and will return after the holidays. Cambros or insulated bags for steam pans, Racks and sternos, Large Gatorade coolers for soup, Hotel pans, Baking pans, Kitchen spoons, Ladles, Measuring cups, Cutting boards, Knives, Colander, Stock pots, Rondo, Sautée pan (large), Grill pan, 2 metro racks, Spreaders/butter knives, Dishes/scoops

properties.description:
REQUESTS:  Needs long-term volunteers 18 years old and up. NO MORE CLOTHES. Need toiletries, soap, work gloves, boots, masks, baby food, cat food, disposable bbq's, camping stoves, pet food, and tampons. The church is located along the s74 & s76 bus routes and walking distance from s53 stop at corner of Clove Rd/narrows Rd.

NOTE TO VOLUNTEERS - NYPD is asking (and trying) to free up the traffic. It's VERY congested in the areas I was in today and
sometimes dangerous. There are piles of waste in front of people's houses that
the ""trucks"" need to get to get to these piles to help clean up but they cant fit down the street because of the donation traffic. Also emergency vehicles can't get through either which is extremely dangerous. My advice is use bikes, shopping carts, ""granny carts"" and carpool as much as
possible. Heavily Needed and in short supply:, Heavy Duty Garbage Bags, Thick
Socks, Construction Work Gloves, Cleaning Supplies (Bleach, Paper Towels, Wipes, rags mops, etc), Possibly tools to help take large items apart to fit through the front door. (think what would break up an old couch), Tarps, Towels, Needed and usually in supply but could always use more:  Blankets!!!, Hot Food!!!, Non Perishable Food, Constructions Masks, Place to charge a cell, Underwear of all kinds and sizes, Bundles of socks, Batteries, Water, Baby Clothes/Pet Food/Shoes all vary from station to station the few I was at today seemed to have them but they were moving slowly and at some donations we had to turn down at times.

properties.title: Philadelphia - TWU Local 234
properties.description:
The Transport Workers Union - Local 234 in Philadelphia has opened wide its doors to Occupy Sandy NJ, finally giving OSNJ its own much-needed distribution hub in a key location. The Occupy Philly community has rallied to help our friends, family, and neighbors in New Jersey, and we are so grateful to have a base for OSNJ operations, thanks to the support and solidarity of the transit workers of Philadelphia. 

The TWU warehouse will take donations between 9am to 5pm. During the week, TWU staff may need to let you in the front of the building. On weekends, when the building occasionally will be closed, we will be set up in the rear of the building, in the parking lot, to receive donations and dispatch volunteers for weekend work-days.

For now, volunteers are needed to help set up our new space and establish systems for tracking inventory, dispatching supplies and volunteers, and managing the flow of people and vehicles. Please call the number listed to volunteer, or show up this weekend.

This weekend, we will mainly be deploying volunteers directly into the field before Saturday morning (either by email, phone, or during Friday night's nightly conference call), but on future weekends we will be arranging large-scale deployments of volunteers to the hardest hit areas of New Jersey. We fully expect the people of Philadelphia to rally to this cause with as much passion and dedication as the people of New York City have, if not more, so we are certain that Local 234's union hall will become a buzzing hive of activity over the coming weeks.


SUPPLIES REQUESTED: 

Note: These are VERY SPECIFIC REQUESTS (we are not accepting most clothes or food at this location). We are only accepting what is most needed by storm survivors, and in short supply or expected to be.

Safety equipment & muck-out equipment - OSHA N95/N92 FACEMASKS, waterproof boots, waterproof work-gloves, hazmat suits and/or heavy-duty overalls, tarps, waterproof plastic bins, pry-bars, garbage bags, headlamps/flashlights, and batteries. 

Construction equipment & personal appliances - drywall, floorboards, lumber, joints, insulation, wiring, hot water heaters, refrigerators, dish-washers, gas or electric ranges/ovens, newer-model personal computers, electric wheelchairs, & generators. 

NO CLOTHING EXCEPT: socks, underwear, heavy-duty winter coats, and muck-out clothing (detailed above). 

NO FOOD EXCEPT: baby food and baby formula. 

No toys please.

PET FOOD is currently accepted, as is BOTTLED WATER.
properties.contact info:
On site, ask for Doug. 
Otherwise, call (201) 503-4241.
properties.dateandtimes: 9am - 5pm, M-F. Occupy Sandy operations at site will vary. See detailed information below.

properties.title: Belmar/Asbury Park Hub @ the Jersey Shore Dream Center
properties.description:
NEEDS/REQUESTS: 

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED:

Starting this FRIDAY, volunteers are needed starting at 8:30am to help load trucks and other vehicles in preparation for a regional distribution of supplies and food to evacuees in six area hotels. Meet at the CHURCH: 2901 18th Ave., Wall, NJ. Then on SATURDAY, we're seeking at least 20 volunteers for an informal canvass of residents found cleaning up their homes or viewing their properties, taking detailed needs-assessments in order to provide aid on an individual basis (come to OFFICE address on Saturday morning, or as early in the afternoon as you can). 

Volunteers will be needed for house guttings (or "muck-outs") and other demolition on Sunday, Monday, and beyond. They should bring as much of the following as possible: OSHA N95/N92 face-masks, waterproof boots, waterproof work-gloves, hazmat suits, heavy-duty work clothes, tarps, waterproof plastic bins, pry-bars, headlamps, batteries, and garbage bags. A change of clothes is a good idea. Contact the on-the-ground P.O.C. to arrange details in advance.

If any VOLUNTEER ORGANIZERS (preferably with experience in Occupy Sandy NYC or NJ) are willing to relocate here for at least a week, their help would be most welcome. This hub has lots of volunteers already, but few organizers and little capacity. Occupy Sandy is working hard to expand their capacity and improve their ability to provide much-needed mutual aid to a devastated part of the New Jersey coast. Interested volunteers should contact Dawn, the current on-the-ground point-of-contact, to arrange local housing. 

SUPPLIES NEEDED:

With an eye toward expanding their capacity to deliver aid they've already amassed, they're seeking a BOX TRUCK for transportation and a large temporary STORAGE FACILITY (either on-site or nearby). 

The same supplies needed in most other places are welcome here as well (baby supplies, socks, underwear, water, cleaning supplies, muck-out supplies, and winter clothing), but the capacity is limited for now, so large donations may need to be turned away until more storage becomes available.
properties.address:
OFFICE: 
2517 Highway 35 
Building 1, Suite 203
Belmar, NJ 07719 

CHURCH :
2901 18th Ave.
Wall, NJ

properties.title: Long Beach Island/Manahawkin Hub @ King of Kings Church
properties.description:
NEEDS/REQUESTS: 

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED: Volunteers are needed all day for lots of SORTING & PACKING, and some local distribution of goods and services. King of Kings Church has fielded a huge and impressive operation. They have heated showers in a trailer behind their gymnasium, which is full of clothes. Their sanctuary is full of food and supplies, and they have a medical clinic complete with free doctors' hours. They are working with other organizations in the area to help Long Beach Island recover from its devastation. As their capacity grows, volunteers will be needed for other tasks, but for now there is a great need for packing, sorting, and local distribution. There is also a need for ORGANIZERS to come help streamline this massive operation. If you're interested in temporarily relocating to the area to organize on behalf of Occupy Sandy, please contact OccupySandyNJ@interoccupy.net to arrange local housing.

SUPPLIES: Non-perishable food items. Baby supplies (food, diapers, formula, clothing). Childrens' clothes. Medical supplies. Waterproof bins. Safety equipment & muck-out equipment (OSHA N95/N92 FACEMASKS, waterproof boots, waterproof work gloves, hazmat suits and/or heavy-duty overalls, tarps, waterproof plastic bins, crow-bars, headlamps, batteries).
properties.contact info: No need to call in advance, for the time being

Paper Towels & Shammies, Disinfectant wipes, First Aid stuff – neosporin, aspirin, tylenol, ibprofen and other OTC drugs, nasal spray, Batteries, Flashlights, Tarps, granny carts, shopping carts, wheelbarrows to transport goods to homes, Faces masks, working gloves and respirators, Gas, & Gas Cans (ideally filled with gas). Generators, Warm socks, Body soap, Shampoo and conditioner, Toothpaste/toothbrush, Sandwich/gallon ziplock bags. Vinegar, blankets

No more donations after 7. No more volunteers after 8.

Large donations should call in advance: (347) 470-4192.

properties.title: Union Beach Hub @ the Union Hose "Firehouse Grille"
properties.description:
NEEDS/REQUESTS: 

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED: 

Muck-out volunteers - please come with muck-out supplies, if possible (OSHA N95/N92 face-masks, waterproof boots, waterproof work-gloves, hazmat suits (or at the very least heavy-duty work clothes you can throw away; and clean clothes, of course), tarps, garbage bags, crow-bars, headlamps, batteries). 

Kitchen volunteers - nespecially in morning, to prepare food for regional distribution, for volunteers, and for residents. More needed on weekends.

Long-term volunteers are invited to camp at this hub, which is run by the Rainbow Superstorm Sandy Response. Please be respectful of the norms of the camp. Be sure to bring very warm clothes, as this is a cold, windy, wet, coastal spot. Bring your own tents and sleeping bags. This camp is located at the site of Union Hose Fire Company #1, at the invitation of the firehouse, so there should be no problems from local authorities. The camp is providing a vital service to the local community without taxing limited local resources.

SUPPLIES NEEDED:

OSHA N95/N92 face-masks, waterproof boots, waterproof work-gloves, hazmat suits, heavy-duty work clothes, tarps, waterproof plastic bins, crow-bars, headlamps, batteries, garbage bags.

Food is always welcome (extra can be sent to other parts of the state), though the camp is incredibly well supplied.

If you plan to bring or send tons of stuff, check in with the P.O.C. on the ground first to ensure they have capacity to receive it.

VOLUNTEERS:

Needed Tuesday - Saturday, 10a - 5p. Looking for 4 chefs per day. People who can do full days preferred. People with culinary experience, and can be efficient in a small space preferred. 

NEEDS: 

Food: Barley, Quinoa, Brown rice, Pasta, Egg noodles, Flour, Sugar, Dried cranberries, Dried apricots, Tortillas, Dried: lentils, split peas, Cooking liquid, Boxes of white and red wine, Guinness stout

Canned: Tomatoes, Canned beans (any), Better than Boullion soup base, Peanut butter, Tuna, Salmon, Canned chicken, Jam, Relish, Tahini, Roasted red peppers, Artichokes, Olives, Capers, Tofu, Baby Corn, Water chestnuts, Canned chiles, Olive oil, Canola oil

Meat: Whole uncut pieces of meat we can break down ourselves are fine. Seriously- any cheap cut of meat will do. No offal. Pork shoulder, Ribs, Stew beef, Ground beef, London broil/skirt steak, Chicken thighs, Bacon, Ham, Hot dogs, Sausage

Vegetables: Onions, Potatoes, Carrots, Celery, Garlic, Sweet potatoes, Apples

Frozen: Edamame, Spinach, Pearl onions, Green beans

Dairy (prefer gift cards for these items): Milk, Cream, Cream cheese, Eggs, Parmesan cheese

Miscellaneous: Paper bags, Take out containers (pints and quarts), Ziplock bags, Aluminum pans with cover, Aluminum foil, Plastic wrap, Sandwich baggies, Deli paper, Latex gloves

Will also need LOTS of fresh produce

Supplies:  Note that we'd be happy borrowing any of this from restaurants who are not using them, and will return after the holidays. Cambros or insulated bags for steam pans, Racks and sternos, Large Gatorade coolers for soup, Hotel pans, Baking pans, Kitchen spoons, Ladles, Measuring cups, Cutting boards, Knives, Colander, Stock pots, Rondo, Sautée pan (large), Grill pan, 2 metro racks, Spreaders/butter knives, Dishes/scoops

REQUESTS:  Needs long-term volunteers 18 years old and up. NO MORE CLOTHES. Need toiletries, soap, work gloves, boots, masks, baby food, cat food, disposable bbq's, camping stoves, pet food, and tampons. The church is located along the s74 & s76 bus routes and walking distance from s53 stop at corner of Clove Rd/narrows Rd.

NOTE TO VOLUNTEERS - NYPD is asking (and trying) to free up the traffic. It's VERY congested in the areas I was in today and
sometimes dangerous. There are piles of waste in front of people's houses that
the ""trucks"" need to get to get to these piles to help clean up but they cant fit down the street because of the donation traffic. Also emergency vehicles can't get through either which is extremely dangerous. My advice is use bikes, shopping carts, ""granny carts"" and carpool as much as
possible. Heavily Needed and in short supply:, Heavy Duty Garbage Bags, Thick
Socks, Construction Work Gloves, Cleaning Supplies (Bleach, Paper Towels, Wipes, rags mops, etc), Possibly tools to help take large items apart to fit through the front door. (think what would break up an old couch), Tarps, Towels, Needed and usually in supply but could always use more:  Blankets!!!, Hot Food!!!, Non Perishable Food, Constructions Masks, Place to charge a cell, Underwear of all kinds and sizes, Bundles of socks, Batteries, Water, Baby Clothes/Pet Food/Shoes all vary from station to station the few I was at today seemed to have them but they were moving slowly and at some donations we had to turn down at times.

properties.title: Philadelphia - TWU Local 234
properties.description:
The Transport Workers Union - Local 234 in Philadelphia has opened wide its doors to Occupy Sandy NJ, finally giving OSNJ its own much-needed distribution hub in a key location. The Occupy Philly community has rallied to help our friends, family, and neighbors in New Jersey, and we are so grateful to have a base for OSNJ operations, thanks to the support and solidarity of the transit workers of Philadelphia. 

The TWU warehouse will take donations between 9am to 5pm. During the week, TWU staff may need to let you in the front of the building. On weekends, when the building occasionally will be closed, we will be set up in the rear of the building, in the parking lot, to receive donations and dispatch volunteers for weekend work-days.

For now, volunteers are needed to help set up our new space and establish systems for tracking inventory, dispatching supplies and volunteers, and managing the flow of people and vehicles. Please call the number listed to volunteer, or show up this weekend.

This weekend, we will mainly be deploying volunteers directly into the field before Saturday morning (either by email, phone, or during Friday night's nightly conference call), but on future weekends we will be arranging large-scale deployments of volunteers to the hardest hit areas of New Jersey. We fully expect the people of Philadelphia to rally to this cause with as much passion and dedication as the people of New York City have, if not more, so we are certain that Local 234's union hall will become a buzzing hive of activity over the coming weeks.


SUPPLIES REQUESTED: 

Note: These are VERY SPECIFIC REQUESTS (we are not accepting most clothes or food at this location). We are only accepting what is most needed by storm survivors, and in short supply or expected to be.

Safety equipment & muck-out equipment - OSHA N95/N92 FACEMASKS, waterproof boots, waterproof work-gloves, hazmat suits and/or heavy-duty overalls, tarps, waterproof plastic bins, pry-bars, garbage bags, headlamps/flashlights, and batteries. 

Construction equipment & personal appliances - drywall, floorboards, lumber, joints, insulation, wiring, hot water heaters, refrigerators, dish-washers, gas or electric ranges/ovens, newer-model personal computers, electric wheelchairs, & generators. 

NO CLOTHING EXCEPT: socks, underwear, heavy-duty winter coats, and muck-out clothing (detailed above). 

NO FOOD EXCEPT: baby food and baby formula. 

No toys please.

PET FOOD is currently accepted, as is BOTTLED WATER.
properties.contact info:
On site, ask for Doug. 
Otherwise, call (201) 503-4241.
properties.dateandtimes: 9am - 5pm, M-F. Occupy Sandy operations at site will vary. See detailed information below.

properties.title: Belmar/Asbury Park Hub @ the Jersey Shore Dream Center
properties.description:
NEEDS/REQUESTS: 

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED:

Starting this FRIDAY, volunteers are needed starting at 8:30am to help load trucks and other vehicles in preparation for a regional distribution of supplies and food to evacuees in six area hotels. Meet at the CHURCH: 2901 18th Ave., Wall, NJ. Then on SATURDAY, we're seeking at least 20 volunteers for an informal canvass of residents found cleaning up their homes or viewing their properties, taking detailed needs-assessments in order to provide aid on an individual basis (come to OFFICE address on Saturday morning, or as early in the afternoon as you can). 

Volunteers will be needed for house guttings (or "muck-outs") and other demolition on Sunday, Monday, and beyond. They should bring as much of the following as possible: OSHA N95/N92 face-masks, waterproof boots, waterproof work-gloves, hazmat suits, heavy-duty work clothes, tarps, waterproof plastic bins, pry-bars, headlamps, batteries, and garbage bags. A change of clothes is a good idea. Contact the on-the-ground P.O.C. to arrange details in advance.

If any VOLUNTEER ORGANIZERS (preferably with experience in Occupy Sandy NYC or NJ) are willing to relocate here for at least a week, their help would be most welcome. This hub has lots of volunteers already, but few organizers and little capacity. Occupy Sandy is working hard to expand their capacity and improve their ability to provide much-needed mutual aid to a devastated part of the New Jersey coast. Interested volunteers should contact Dawn, the current on-the-ground point-of-contact, to arrange local housing. 

SUPPLIES NEEDED:

With an eye toward expanding their capacity to deliver aid they've already amassed, they're seeking a BOX TRUCK for transportation and a large temporary STORAGE FACILITY (either on-site or nearby). 

The same supplies needed in most other places are welcome here as well (baby supplies, socks, underwear, water, cleaning supplies, muck-out supplies, and winter clothing), but the capacity is limited for now, so large donations may need to be turned away until more storage becomes available.
properties.address:
OFFICE: 
2517 Highway 35 
Building 1, Suite 203
Belmar, NJ 07719 

CHURCH :
2901 18th Ave.
Wall, NJ

Water, clothing (especially socks, underwear and sweats), shoes, non-perishable food, baby food and baby supplies, toiletries, cleaning supplies, batteries/flashlights and
lanterns, demolition tools (pry bars, sledge hammers, garbage bags), tarps, daily newspapers, batteries (A, AAA, D).

properties.title: ASSEMBLYMAN MIKE MILLER
properties.description: Volunteers are needed 83-91 Woodhaven Blvd (GMAP). They are using Assembly member Miller’s office as a staging location to bring supplies to the Rockaways. They need blankets, clothers, food, cars with gas to move the stuff etc.

properties.title: ST. JOSEPH BY THE SEA
properties.description: Food, Clothing, batteries, anything.

properties.title: Long Beach City Ice Rink
properties.description: NEEDS: diapers (newborn up), food items (cereal, rice, boxed mixes, pasta, teas, coffee), cleaning supplies

properties.title: FLUSHING TOWN HALL
properties.dateandtimes: 12 pm - 5 pm for as long as needed.

properties.title: RESORTS WORLD CASINO IN OZONE PARK
properties.description:
NYPD representatives and volunteers will be on scene in white tents to collect everything from canned goods to coats and shoes for city residents who lost everything in the
storm. We’ll be collecting clothing, sweatshirts, hats, packages of bottled
water, toiletries, and non-perishables.
properties.address: 110-00 Rockaway Blvd South Ozone Park, NY 11420

properties.title: ST. CLARE'S
properties.description: Needs volunteers and donations. No clothes.

properties.title: Lutheran Church of the Good Shepherd, (Church Offices)
properties.dateandtimes: Mon, Wed, Fri: 8am-2pm, and Tues, Thurs: 8am-6pm.

properties.title: Gowanus Community Center // operated by FUREE
properties.description:
NEEDS: Flashlights, batteries, candles, 
gloves/scarves/hats. Hot food (before 6pm only), canned food and pantry items: Updated supply requests at facebook.com/FUREEous. 

VOLUNTEERS: throughout the afternoon/evening for meal deliveries.
properties.address:
420 Baltic St, between Hoyt and Bond
(in the middle of the block, on the south side)

properties.title: Full Gospel Tabernacle
properties.description:
Anyone who wants to VOLUNTEER their time for cleanup, crews will be starting every day at 12pm. 

Please wear work clothes and bring your own lunch/dinner. 

NEEDS: cleaning supplies, canned goods, bottled water and toilet paper

properties.title: Youth Israel of Wavecrest
properties.description: Major needs are new thermals, new winter socks, hanging lanterns with flourescent bulbs, kids toys, diapers, wipes, kosher food (only).

properties.title: American Legion
properties.description:
VOLUNTEERS: needed to help organize and manage distribution.

NEEDS:  power strips/heavy duty power cords, duct tape, plastic sheathing, rope, tarps, contractor-sized trash bags, personal care items like razors, always need flashlights and batteries, baby formula, diapers ***AND** we need hot food throughout the day plus packaged food is ALWAYS welcomed. **Blankets. , socks, underwear, jackets are ALWAYS welcomed but no other clothes can be accepted at this time!**

properties.title:
ATLAS PARK MALL, at
the old BORDERS STORE
JIMMY VAN BRAMER
properties.description: Collecting water, food, blankets, warm clothes, batteries and cell phone chargers.

properties.title: APEC
properties.description: Newish clothing, canned goods, nonperishable food, and manual can openers.

properties.title: Third Root Community Health Center
properties.description: We are collecting every kind of donated item EXCEPT for perishable food items!

properties.title: Church of St. Edward the Martyr (Episcopal)
properties.description: Accepting supplies - NO clothes, please. Call the church office at (212) 369-1140 if you need help. To enter, come to the red doors and ring office bell.

properties.title: Long Beach Island/Manahawkin Hub @ King of Kings Church
properties.description:
NEEDS/REQUESTS: 

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED: Volunteers are needed all day for lots of SORTING & PACKING, and some local distribution of goods and services. King of Kings Church has fielded a huge and impressive operation. They have heated showers in a trailer behind their gymnasium, which is full of clothes. Their sanctuary is full of food and supplies, and they have a medical clinic complete with free doctors' hours. They are working with other organizations in the area to help Long Beach Island recover from its devastation. As their capacity grows, volunteers will be needed for other tasks, but for now there is a great need for packing, sorting, and local distribution. There is also a need for ORGANIZERS to come help streamline this massive operation. If you're interested in temporarily relocating to the area to organize on behalf of Occupy Sandy, please contact OccupySandyNJ@interoccupy.net to arrange local housing.

SUPPLIES: Non-perishable food items. Baby supplies (food, diapers, formula, clothing). Childrens' clothes. Medical supplies. Waterproof bins. Safety equipment & muck-out equipment (OSHA N95/N92 FACEMASKS, waterproof boots, waterproof work gloves, hazmat suits and/or heavy-duty overalls, tarps, waterproof plastic bins, crow-bars, headlamps, batteries).
properties.contact info: No need to call in advance, for the time being
